message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO

This paper focuses on neural network-based language learning agents that can interpret single-word instructions in a simulated 3D world. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

The paper also discusses the challenges of grounded language learning, which involves understanding language in the context of the visual world. This suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which deals with intelligent agents and machine learning. 

The paper uses policy-gradient methods to train the agent, which falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The simulated 3D world involves visual scenes, which suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision), which deals with image and video analysis. 

Finally, the paper explores the conditions under which established human biases and learning effects emerge, which could also place it in the category of cs.RO (Robotics), which deals with intelligent systems that interact with the physical world.
